posts.cooked: At a technical level, could you clarify how the camera quality adjustment on the dashboard side reduces bandwidth? If compression occurs on the driver station, wouldn't the camera still transmit the full resolution over the network?

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
Sure! Here's the cleaned-up version based on your instructions:

---

"Thanks for doing this. Please excuse me if this is already explained somewhere, but two things I've seen in other dashboards but not found in Elastic are: Multiple values on one graph, e.g., dragging them in Customize field objects, e.g., to look like game pieces."

--- 

Let me know if you need further adjustments!

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: I am encountering a problem that I also faced in the last version. Opening Elastic simply shows an invisible window. When attempting to open the app, nothing displays on both the portable and installer versions, an issue that occurred previously but was resolved after reverting to an earlier version.

posts.name: Dan Peled
posts.cooked: The field object thing is currently being worked on by me.

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: Are you also adding the ability to rotate the field vertically?

posts.name: Dan Peled
posts.cooked: Wdym vertically? To have the top be the other alliance? I can add that ig.

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: Yes, the image can be accessed via the link https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/f/8/f870cb2297c4f4d80d566bdfc3cfb2405962059b.png, with dimensions 259×560 pixels and a file size of 55.8 KB.

posts.name: Dan Peled
posts.cooked: "I'll add that, may I ask what would be the purpose of that?"

posts.name: Lidor Kaplan
posts.cooked: In that case, the desired orientation depends on the alliance color. Red alliance view should be 180-rotated from the above screenshot.

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: It’s not crucial whether your alliance goes down, but if it has the ability to flip, it could be beneficial to other teams (and should be considered optional).

posts.name: Gal
posts.cooked: It's nice to put the field on the side so it's not in the middle of the screen.

posts.name: Dan Peled
posts.cooked: I'll rotate and you choose.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked: One use case where we want the field to be vertical in a dashboard is to quickly present an overview to someone unfamiliar with FIRST Robotics Competition, which may include new programmers, drive team members, school administrators, parents, or potential sponsors. For a field-relative drive, "joystick up" means moving away from the alliance wall, and offering a simulation where joystick movements mirror robot actions can enhance understanding.

posts.name: AllenGregoryIV
posts.cooked: For a field-relative drive, “joystick up” is away from the alliance wall. It’s nice to give someone a sim where joystick up moves the virtual robot up, right goes right, etc. This would be my preferred view in every field2d display, it would be great if this also existed in glass and AdvantageScope. Driver station perspective makes sense for most things to me.

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked: Orientation rotation in 90-degree increments exists in the Odometry tab of the Advantage Scope 4.0 Beta. This feature may not apply to earlier versions.

posts.name: Jonah Bonner
posts.cooked: Yep, this feature has been supported since 2023.

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked: Parameters are passed into the HTTP request and the logic for compression and resolution changing is handled on the server side.

link_counts.title: Introducing Elastic: A simple and modern alternative to Shuffleboard

posts.name: Nadav
posts.cooked:
That’s interesting I’ll try to look into it but I’ll need some help with debugging on your side  
First open the app on the latest version then leave it open for a bit and then close it  

In file explorer if you type %AppData%/com.gold872/elastic_dashboard there should be a file called elastic-log.txt could you send that so I can look into it  

Another piece of information that would be helpful is the system summary In the search at the bottom of the screen type in System Information and send a screenshot of the information under System Type and Processor

posts.name: Christopher Coleman
posts.cooked: Could the field be mirrored based on what alliance the DS [Driver Station] has selected/given so that it doesn’t have to be changed manually?

accepted_answer.excerpt: Elastic 2025.2.2 A critical issue was resolved with 2025.2.1 where the chooser would not publish the value after the robot code restarts. The broken release has been pulled and a new release has been published with the fix. See this thread for more info. The update can be downloaded here, or if you…
